One of my favorite games of all time. The way the game makes you come back to it after you have nothing to do is incredible. The look, feel, gameplay - everything is perfect. Portal 2 is really good, but it doesn't have the same energy and aestethic as the first game. 11/10, I recommend it a lot. You're missing out a lot in this game - it's worth buying.
The hardest achievement "Aperture Science" literally requires you to cheat, use portal and other glitches. So I cheated.

An amazing game, however I'll note it here that the sequel is a lot better, despite what most people would say.

If you're coming into this game thinking it's a puzzle game: please, think otherwise, because in my opinion this is not a puzzle game.

It appears as a puzzle game, but if anything, it is more of a first person shooter that requires you to think a bit, however the game rarely ever becomes challenging.

The reason I say this is because the game goes through a cycle multiple times, where a mechanic is shown, 2 or 3 chambers is done on it, and a new mechanic is shown in a chamber with the same difficulty as the one from 4 chambers before.

This makes the game go from easy to hard, to easy, then back to hard, and you get the point.

Only the final few chambers actually fully become slightly challenging, incorporating multiple elements (except the turret chamber), however these chambers aren't even really puzzles, they're just levels that require precision and good timing to complete them, instead of thought like Portal 2 had.

This pacing is then ruined again by the 'Behind The Scenes' portion of the game, as I'd like to call it, where the cycle begins again with rocket turrets and then the final boss.

If you're looking for a puzzle game, for sure get Portal 2, but if you're looking for a first person shooter get this.

Despite the heavy amount of criticism in here, the game I think is one of the most replayable games for that very reason, as it becomes less of a puzzle game and rather as a fun challenge you can play a number of times.

Portal 2 overall is a better product than this due to it's longer length and massive amount of content it has, but this game is still fantastic and should be a must-buy.

Finally got around to actually playing the game after buying it a few years ago.  I'm so glad I finally did.  Its just a simple yet challenging story puzzle game that i can definitely recommend.

This is a game that once you beat it, you will want to keep coming back for more. Memorable puzzles, dark sense of humor, and a hell lot of thinking, will get you to fall in love with this near 15 year old gem more with multiple playthroughs.

I am very late to the party but it still holds up extremely well today. I love the very subtle story telling in the game and the humor is just untouchable. Lots of personality in the game and the concept is still mind boggling today. This is a must have game and probably makes it one of my top 6 games.

a pesar de ser un juego corto, disfrute mucho de el, primero, los acertijos exprimen muy bien la mecanica de los portales y la curva de dificultad no es tan extrema si no que es un juego dificil sin llegar a sert frustrante, en mi opinion los efectos de sonido son muy buenos y ambientan bien el juego, hay juegos que son buenos sin tener musica y este es uno de estos, las pocas canciones que contiene las implementa muy bien.
es muy divertido ponerse a jugar con los portales fuera de resolver acertijos y el apartado visual es muy bueno para la fecha en la que salio.

ahora hablando mas de la historia(deja de leer si no lo has jugado)

en todo el juego se nos presenta una protagonista silenciosa lo cual se me hace bueno ya que asi el jugador puede proyectar su personalidad perfectamente, a pesar de esto si analizas bien al personaje por medio de secretos o acciones del jugador podras deducir mas o menos su personalidad, el villano principal GLaDOS se implementa muy bien ya que en sus dialogos se puede notar algo extra√±o despues de cierta parte, tambien es interesante el encontrar distintos textos que escribio un sobreviviente ya que estos te dan pistas sobre la historia del juego, por ultimo la batalla final contra GLaDOS es muy entretenida ya que pone a prueba lo que aprendimos y nos da un limite lo cual te pone en ambiente con el combate, lleno de tension.

I'm finishing this game in one sit due to curiosity about the Aperture Science Lab and the connection with Black Mesa, and guess what? Instead of finding the connection, I drowned into confusions and what happened in the ending still makes me speechless. 
The gameplay was very fun, puzzle platforming with a "portal" mechanic was a unique experience for me. Some of the puzzle rooms were very challenging, so you really need to use your brain. Sadly the story is very, very short, but don't worry, you can play the bonus levels with tons of difficulty which is unlock some extra content. not to mention that this game has a very, very good and sweet ending song that almost make me dropped tears.
9/10 for the score, very recommended!

ta weno

I will never forget my first time playing this game; a desolate and sterile environment belie something unsettling and strange, 'Where am I?' 'What am I doing here?' 'Am I alone?'. I could not keep my eyes off the screen while exploring this game.

If you think that puzzle games aren't your strong suit and would normally pass up games like this, I implore you to give Portal a try. It's not only got great atmosphere, it also rocks a top soundtrack and the gameplay itself will change your perception of portals and have you think in ways you hadn't considered before. One of my favorite games in any genre and platform.
